It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, where it forms a symbiotic relationship with mycorrhizal fungi. Due to its limited habitat and sensitivity to environmental changes, Pedicularis petrophila is considered a vulnerable species.
